text: [Music]
hey guys it's Elise welcome back to my
cupcake addiction today we're gonna be
making an amazing giant Twix no Baker
slice love this because it's no bake so
anyone can make it and because of the
giant Twix so anyone can eat it let's
get started to make your Twix bar you're
going to need a nice long tin I'm using
either a bar tin or a loaf tin and I've
got mine lined today with a bit of
baking paper you need some good-quality
compound milk chocolate and also some
terrible choose these ones are Werther's
craft it's great in the US but just a
firm caramel chewy lollies you'll need
roughly 30 shortbread biscuits for the
size that I've got and I just buy these
in packets they're not very expensive
these ones are actually the perfect size
for my little bar tin I've got a couple
of spoons I've got my mini Twix just for
comparison and I may have to sample them
as I go so let's get started the first
thing you want to do is you want to make
sure that your tin is lined with one
large piece like mine here in the center
and two smaller pieces at either end
this is gonna make it a lot easier to
get your Twix out at the end when it's
finished then if you line up with little
separate pieces of baking paper
everywhere take your melted chocolate
now and you just want to pour it about a
centimeter thick into the bottom of your
loaf pan which will actually become the
top of your Twix bar just pour it in
then use a spoon to kind of level it out
and push it into all the corners and
then you want to give it a couple of
really nice hard taps on the bench make
sure here that your baking paper sort of
stays folded over the sides or else
you're gonna end up with a bit of a kink
in the side of your Twix bar and then
it's not gonna cover so well pop it off
into the fridge to set while that one
setting you want to melt your Karen will
choose so I did mine in 30-second
intervals in the microwave and they took
about a minute and a half for all of
those caramel or cheese to melt down you
can see how lovely and thick and firm
this caramel is spoon your caramel on
top of that chocolate and that chocolate
should be frigid set and then use the
back of the spoon just to work it out to
all of the corners but you don't really
want to go right up against the outside
edges the baking paper if you can avoid
it get it as neat as you possibly can
and as
and then take your shortbread biscuits
and we're going to do two layers of
shortbread biscuit now if your tin is
slightly taller you might want to adjust
your measurements here a little more
caramel and extra row of biscuits really
this is a super easy slice and you just
want to do it by eye with my first row
of biscuits all in nice and neat I'm
gonna pop that back off into the fridge
to let that caramelize it's gonna be
starting to try to melt through our top
layer of chocolate so don't make that
top layer of chocolate too thin once
it's set you can melt down a little bit
more of I like the caramel all the
chocolates fine and then you just want
to spoon on an extra spoonful and use
that as kind of a glue to stick your
next layer of shortbread biscuits down
you do need to glue these to each other
or else when you cut into the slice the
biscuits gonna fall apart and each
person's slice of your Twix bars going
to fall apart when your next layer of
biscuits is in place you just want to
take some more of that melted milk
chocolate and pour it over now you don't
want this to extend past the lip of your
loaf tin or your bar tin give it a
couple of really good hard taps down on
the bench because you want to make sure
that all of that chocolate gets down
into the sides and gets into all of the
grooves that's gonna take a couple of
hours in the fridge to completely set
and when it comes out it should be nice
and firm and solid so peel off the
baking paper and then you're going to
need to grab yourself a tray lined with
baking paper with a couple of glasses
this is just to elevate the Twix bar pop
the Twix bar up on top and then you want
to take some more of that melted milk
compound chocolate now if that compound
chocolate is too thick here you can thin
it out with a little bit of Crisco or a
little bit of COFA just pour it all the
way over the top as evenly as you can
and working quite quickly before it
starts to set just use a spatula or even
the back of a knife just to smooth out
the sides once you've smoothed up the
sides let it drip for a little bit and
then just use your spatula knife just to
trim off that very very bottom line so
you've got a nice neat base finally you
just want to take the back of a spoon
and just kind of run it ever so lightly
in the top chocolate and just back and
forward to give it that kind of
chocolatey bar top shape be careful here
is that might push a little bit of extra
chocolate over the edges so have your
spatula knife at the ready and make sure
you do this for all the chocolates still
wet so you can neaten up
any over spills before they set so there
you've got your awesome three ingredient
no bake giant Twix bar slice you can
make one of these or you could make many
and join them together to make a mammoth
Twix bar I love this it is my go-to
recipe when I need something in a hurry
and trust me when you bring this into
our party for some reason it is always
the first thing to go I have no idea why
for more cool candy and candy bar
inspired recipes make sure you subscribe
to my cupcake addiction or you can head
on over and follow the my cupcake
addiction Instagram where I post all
kinds of delicious pictures of all the
tasty things that I find on my travels
thanks very much for watching
